intro: Dontostemon hispidus, commonly known as the roughleaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
